author: {'steamid': '76561197961768818', 'num_games_owned': 4046, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1534132908}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053979898', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1532805944}
review: Poor user experience, not fun past potentially the first level. The concept is mildly interesting but is ruined by an intentionally frustrating and timewasting execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136674222', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1514144533}
review:
First: Achievements are broken. Done the first level multiple times, nothing. Pointing this first because if you wanna get those achievements, you won't be able to.

Second: If you're deaf, you play it "die and retry" style. Even if you were to play windowed and "smartly" play using the Volume Mixer to check if there's noise, some ground traps do noises too, which would make parasites. An ingame wall-sound direction ingame would be nice for everyone, even those who can't hear.

Third: Interesting gameplay, but since there's no "random" and/or "infinite" mode, there is no replayability, which would have been a REALLY nice thing to have.

Fourth: Since there's no random element in the game, even if you replay a finished level, the path stay the same. It's possible for the player to draw a map to follow and 

With all this, and AMIDEA Games not updating their games here, at least for fixing the achievements, it's a no-no for me.

EDIT: Searched, found out they're on Greenlight. Immediate no for a dev team not keeping up and throwing games in the consumers face like some AAA companies...

Wanna see? http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=830824661

author: {'steamid': '76561198304022434', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1511353759}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999730961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 343, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1503622528}
review:
It's... It's really bad.

I was really interested by the concept and wondered what the devs might have done with it, but in the end it's nothing more than a plain old maze that you navigate in First Person pov.

The twist is that the walls of invisible, and to tell whetehr there's a wall or not, you have to literally stand 2 inches away from said wall, on misstep and you,re instantly dead. The fact that everything looks exactly the same prevents you from knowing where you're headed, so the game turns out into brute-forcing your way through a crappy maze by sticking your face next to every potentially deadly wall. And accidentally die. A lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051535131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1475414573}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043968215', 'num_games_owned': 10014, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1489868105}
review:
Concept-wise seemed promising, but the execution is lacking. For a game called Maze Sounds, one would expect at least a Sound glider in the options menu. I mean: did you expect me to set the volume manually, like some sort of paesant?!

It is minimalistic, just like this review, and probably in the right circumstances might be interesting...but I just found it tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021492219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1479729720}
review:
Ideia parece muito legal, mas a aplicação foi muito ruim, tem de estar muito perto das paredes para escutar o som, talvez se desse para escutar o tempo todo, mas em volume menor seria melhor, porém da forma que está a tarefa se torna muito massante e cansativa.

Ideia legal, aplicação rasa, cansa rapidamente (eu joguei até abusar de morrer às cegas, olhe quanto tempo tive de jogo).
Tem potencial, torço para o desenvolvedor aprender com os problemas deste jogo e gerar melhores jogos no futuro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993423351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1479572348}
review: Where the sound is coming is too unclear. As result we have are inadequate difficulty of the game. The idea is interesting and new, but the implementation is bad. I did not finish the 1st level even. Progress too slow and gameplay unsatisfying. Also here is no options present except resolution and overal quality. Nothing more! No mouse invert, no keys rebind, no sound options. I am not on WASD and with inverted mouse so playing this was even more painful. Game seriously lacks a lot of features. They need to do more work on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274205588', 'num_games_owned': 1333, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1496829961}
review: Когда впервый раз приобрел игру она не запускалась, т.к. нопки меню игры не работали. При соврачивание в трей прыгал масштаб, он увеличивался. Танцы с бубном не помогли. Вернул игру назад. Печально, ведь по обзорам игра хорошая и очень хотелось её поюзать. После выхода исправлений, на распродаже приобрел снова, работает. Не прогадал: игра своеобразная, в какой то степени уникальная, мне лично понравилась - она скрасила мою библиотеку игр. Меняю оценку на палец вверх.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969645527', 'num_games_owned': 2797, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1478640246}
review:
I didn't realize this was an actual maze where you just have to guess your way through with sound playing if you are approaching an incorrect route. If you accidentally touch the invisible wall into the incorrect route you will be killed instantly, having to retrace your steps since the last checkpoint. This quickly, and I mean really quickly, became a tedious act of trying to remember where I had tried to walk and guessing where the path would go next. While the idea of sound guided navigation was intruguing the way it is implemented here leaves a lot to be desired, only acting as a sort of minimal warning that you are approaching the next square from the wrong side.

If you really love mazes and don't mind inching yourself through one with outmost care to not screw up and have to redo it, this might be for you. Not for me though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000403136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1477875712}
review:
I wish the "[i]Do you recommend this game?[/i]" had a "[b]Maybe[/b]" button. 

It says "[i]Partial Controller Support[/i] on the store page. I spent 15 minutes trying to get it to see my X-Box 360 controller. No luck. (All my other games see it just fine.)

My remaining 15-20 minutes on record was spent trying to get through the first level. The first level should have [i][b][u]SOME[/u][/b][/i] forgiveness, instead of slamming you back to the entryway. I may have stood a chance if I had had a sheet of graph paper handy, but it was not meant to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011818767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1477897828}
review:
This is an interesting idea, but the execution has a lot of flaws. Sound doesn't start playing until you're very close to the wall, which means you have to move very slowly in order to get the warning at all. Because your movement speed is relatively fast, this means tapping the move keys repeatedly so as to not gain momentum. The first checkpoint takes a ridiculously long time to get to, as every oppotunity was taken to force you in the opposite direction through the most meandering path possible. When you hit a wall and restart, it becomes partly a game of memory to try and get through sections you've already done, otherwise you're going at the same snail's pace as the first time.

It feels to me like a game that didn't get enough blind playtesting. It's a good idea, and while the execution works on a technical level, there's just nowhere near enough thought put into the player experience, and mitigating what feel like obvious frustrations inherent in this design. It seems like the developers made the exact game they set out to make, without adjusting along the way for what the actual experience is like. It's tempting to recommend this based on the fact that it's unique, and I'd like to see more games take chances like this has (particularly with uniquely using sound), but the core gameplay loop is just too stilted as it stands now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995738518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1475515438}
review:
Товарищи геймеры!!! Шлю вам мэсэдж... 
ЗАпустил игру в 12.00, начал играть... и в течение 15 минут единственное что мне хотелось так это удалить игру, а разработчиков назвать упырями и никогда не играть больше в их игры, слишком мутарно и сложно мне показалась игра. Но спустя судьбоносные 15 минут меня стало затягивать в необычный мир звуков и полумрака... Скажу так, когда я вновь посмотрел на часы был уже глубокий вечар (около 18.00) а за окном моросил дождик и какая та грёбаная псина лаяла за окном мешая мне играть!!!! 
Вывод.... Игра очень необычная, интересная и затягивающая... И если вам нравится пошевелить мозгами то покупайте не раздумывая. По моему мнению эта игра стоит намного больше чем 150 рублей!
А те кто любит только мачилово, сиськи, "э.. рашим... э... мачи его... курва," то я думаю что не стоит тратить деньги вам эта игра не понравится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1475656378}
review:
[h1]A Sound-Based First Person Puzzle Game[/h1]
https://youtu.be/J7ExIia0k_w
+ Very unique gameplay. You have to navigate through a series of mazes. The walls are invisable and deadly if touched. Each wall emits sounds (voices) when you get close to it. You use this to navigate through the invisible maze. 
+ Each wall seems to emit recordings of famous speeches. I recognized one which happened to be Martin Luther King's "I Have a Dream" speech. They can be interesting to listen to.

- The game gets  tedius rather quickly. A key that is right in front of you may not be obtainable until you go all the way around the outside of the entire stage, zig-zagging back and fourth as there's only 1 correct path to take and it's always the longest most tiresome route.
- Although I like that this game was trying to be different, the concept wasn't very fun for me personally. I feel like the game could have been improved if you could hear sounds from farther distances, and perhaps if walls didn't kill you if touched. (You can lose a lot of progress if you hit a wall)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016096893', 'num_games_owned': 11947, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1475425221}
review:
Оригинальная головоломка в которой ваши уши должны работать совместно с мозгами) Пару раундов, чтоб понять о чем я:

https://youtu.be/1wXQvcKciRs

Ваша задача в игре пройти через лабиринт с невидимыми стенами. Но стены не простые, они под электричеством и дотрагиваться до них нельзя, кирдык будет! А для того, чтоб узнать есть стена или нет - ван нужно подойти к ней и если ваш радио локатор уловит одну из мировых радио станций - то значит здесть стена, нужно искать другой выход.
Невидимые стены это еще не все что вас ожидает в игре, в часности в лабиринтах, чем дальше вы будите продвигаться по уровням, тем больше сюрпризов вас ожидает в лабиринтах, такие как: двери, ключ от которой вам нажно найди в лабиринте, какие то крутящиеся омуты - пропадают и появляются по истечению времени, и многие другие - увидеть которые вы сможете продвагаясь на более поздние уровни.

Графика в игре на "отлично", музыкального сопровождения нет, как как звук в этой игре - ваш поводырь. 

Из минусов: В игре нет таких приятных бонусов как достижения и коллекционные карточки, ну это все поправимо и в руках разработчиков.

Для любителей головоломок советую опробовать игру, так как идея оригинальная и больше такого гемплея вы не найдете не где, по крайней мере я такого больше не видел не где.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136724378', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1498762182}
review:
Все началось с того что в группе(в вк) я увидел пост про эту игру, и просьба поддержать. Я смотрел задумку игры, трейлер, и проголосовал в Greenlight. Меня очень поражает задумка игры, ты должен выйти из лабиринта,но по ЗВУКАМ!
Плюсы:
- Графика. Unreal Engine 4 выдает на моем ведре 130фпс, на ультра в Full HD. Все очень классно детализированно
- Задумка игры. Она необыкновенна)
Минусы:
- Не понравился интерфейс, в демо версии игры его там практически не было
10\10
